title: Matthew Chapter 9 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 9 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 9 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 9.

questions.question: What did Jesus say to the man sick of the palsy when he saw their faith?
options: Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee
Arise, and walk
Peace be unto thee
Thy faith hath made thee whole
questions.correctAnswer: Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'Son, be of good cheer; thy sins be forgiven thee' when he saw their faith (Matthew 9:2).

questions.question: Who did Jesus call to follow him while sitting at the receipt of custom?
options: Matthew
John
Peter
Judas
questions.correctAnswer: Matthew
questions.explanation: Jesus saw Matthew sitting at the receipt of custom and said to him, 'Follow me,' and Matthew followed him (Matthew 9:9).

questions.question: What did the Pharisees ask about Jesus eating with publicans and sinners?
options: Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?
Who gave you permission to eat with sinners?
Why do you not fast like us?
Why do you heal on the Sabbath?
questions.correctAnswer: Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?
questions.explanation: The Pharisees asked, 'Why eateth your Master with publicans and sinners?' when they saw Jesus eating with them (Matthew 9:11).

questions.question: According to Jesus, who needs a physician?
options: They that are sick
They that are whole
The righteous
The Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: They that are sick
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'They that be whole need not a physician, but they that are sick' (Matthew 9:12).

questions.question: Why did Jesus say he came, according to Matthew 9:13?
options: To call sinners to repentance
To enforce the law strictly
To teach only the righteous
To perform miracles only
questions.correctAnswer: To call sinners to repentance
questions.explanation: Jesus said he came 'not to call the righteous, but sinners to repentance' (Matthew 9:13).

questions.question: What analogy did Jesus use to explain why his disciples did not fast?
options: Children of the bridechamber cannot mourn while the bridegroom is with them
New wine must be put into new bottles
No man putteth a piece of new cloth unto an old garment
The harvest is plenteous but the labourers are few
questions.correctAnswer: Children of the bridechamber cannot mourn while the bridegroom is with them
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'Can the children of the bridechamber mourn, as long as the bridegroom is with them?' (Matthew 9:15).

questions.question: What happened when the woman with the issue of blood touched Jesus' garment?
options: She was made whole
She was rebuked
She was ignored
She fell unconscious
questions.correctAnswer: She was made whole
questions.explanation: Jesus told her, 'Thy faith hath made thee whole,' and she was healed from that hour (Matthew 9:22).

questions.question: What did Jesus say about the ruler's daughter whom everyone thought was dead?
options: The maid is not dead, but sleepeth
She is beyond help
She is truly dead
She will never rise again
questions.correctAnswer: The maid is not dead, but sleepeth
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'Give place: for the maid is not dead, but sleepeth' (Matthew 9:24).

questions.question: What did Jesus do after the ruler worshipped him and asked to heal his daughter?
options: He arose and followed him
He healed the daughter immediately
He refused to go
He sent disciples instead
questions.correctAnswer: He arose and followed him
questions.explanation: Jesus arose and followed the ruler, as did his disciples (Matthew 9:19).

questions.question: When Jesus healed the two blind men, what did he say about their faith?
options: According to your faith be it unto you
Your faith is weak
Faith is not needed for healing
You must fast to be healed
questions.correctAnswer: According to your faith be it unto you
questions.explanation: Jesus said, 'According to your faith be it unto you' when he touched their eyes (Matthew 9:29).

questions.question: What did the Pharisees accuse Jesus of when he cast out devils?
options: He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils
He was performing miracles by God's power
He was a prophet sent by God
He was healing by the Spirit
questions.correctAnswer: He casteth out devils through the prince of the devils
questions.explanation: The Pharisees said Jesus cast out devils through the prince of the devils (Matthew 9:34).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus taught in synagogues and preached the gospel of the kingdom in all cities and villages.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus went about all cities and villages, teaching in synagogues and preaching the gospel of the kingdom (Matthew 9:35).

questions.question: True or False: The multitudes were scattered and fainted like sheep having no shepherd.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus saw the multitudes fainted and scattered as sheep having no shepherd (Matthew 9:36).

questions.question: True or False: Jesus said the harvest is plenteous but the labourers are few.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Jesus told his disciples that the harvest is truly plenteous but the labourers are few (Matthew 9:37).

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'Pray ye therefore the Lord of the harvest, that he will send forth ______ into his harvest.'
options: labourers
angels
disciples
prophets
questions.correctAnswer: labourers
questions.explanation: Jesus instructed to pray that the Lord of the harvest would send forth labourers into his harvest (Matthew 9:38).

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 9 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 9 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with doubt about God's power to forgive sins. Based on Matthew 9, what biblical truth would you share about faith and forgiveness?
options: Jesus has authority on earth to forgive sins and heals according to faith
Only priests can forgive sins
Forgiveness is earned by good works
People must confess publicly to be forgiven
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus has authority on earth to forgive sins and heals according to faith
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:2-6 shows Jesus forgiving the paralytic's sins and healing him, demonstrating His authority to forgive sins on earth and the importance of faith. This passage teaches us to trust Jesus' power to forgive and heal.

questions.question: How does Jesus’ interaction with Matthew the tax collector teach us about humility and obedience in following Christ?
options: Matthew immediately followed Jesus when called, showing humility and obedience
Matthew refused to follow Jesus because of his occupation
Jesus told Matthew to stay at his tax booth
Matthew had to complete a ritual before following Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: Matthew immediately followed Jesus when called, showing humility and obedience
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:9 shows that upon Jesus’ call, Matthew rose and followed Him without hesitation, illustrating the virtue of humble obedience to Christ’s invitation.

questions.question: A believer is criticized for associating with those considered 'sinners.' Based on Matthew 9, how should we understand Jesus’ approach to fellowship and evangelism?
options: Jesus welcomed sinners and publicans to call them to repentance
Jesus avoided sinners to maintain purity
Only religious leaders should associate with sinners
Sinners should be shunned by believers
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus welcomed sinners and publicans to call them to repentance
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:10-13 teaches that Jesus dined with sinners to show mercy and call them to repentance, emphasizing compassion and evangelism without judgment.

questions.question: How does the passage about fasting in Matthew 9 teach us about the timing and purpose of spiritual disciplines?
options: Spiritual disciplines are appropriate when Jesus, the Bridegroom, is absent
Fasting should be done constantly without regard to circumstances
Spiritual disciplines are unnecessary
Only Pharisees should fast regularly
questions.correctAnswer: Spiritual disciplines are appropriate when Jesus, the Bridegroom, is absent
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:14-15 explains that Jesus compared His presence to the Bridegroom’s presence, indicating that fasting and mourning are fitting when He is absent, teaching discernment in practice of disciplines.

questions.question: What practical lesson about spiritual renewal and church life is taught by the parable of new cloth and new wine in Matthew 9?
options: New teachings and revival require new hearts and openness
Old traditions should never change
New wine must be mixed with old bottles to preserve it
Spiritual renewal is unnecessary
questions.correctAnswer: New teachings and revival require new hearts and openness
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:16-17 uses the images of new cloth and new wine to illustrate that new spiritual life must be received by new hearts, teaching the need for openness and renewal.

questions.question: A parent is grieving the loss of a child. Based on Matthew 9, what encouragement about Jesus’ power and compassion can be shared?
options: Jesus can restore life and brings comfort even in death
Death is final and unchangeable
Grief should be hidden and not expressed
Only miracles happen to the righteous
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus can restore life and brings comfort even in death
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:18-26 recounts Jesus raising the ruler’s daughter and comforting the woman with faith, showing His power over death and compassionate care for the grieving.

questions.question: How does the healing of the woman with the issue of blood teach us about faith and perseverance in trials?
options: Faith in Jesus’ power brings healing even after long suffering
Healing requires public declaration
Only immediate faith is effective
Healing is only for the young
questions.correctAnswer: Faith in Jesus’ power brings healing even after long suffering
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:20-22 shows the woman’s persistent faith despite twelve years of suffering, illustrating the power of faith and perseverance through trials.

questions.question: What does Jesus’ question to the blind men about their belief teach about trust and receiving God’s blessings?
options: Belief in Jesus’ ability is essential to receiving healing
Healing happens regardless of faith
Faith is optional for miracles
Only physical actions matter
questions.correctAnswer: Belief in Jesus’ ability is essential to receiving healing
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:28-29 shows Jesus asking if they believe He can heal, emphasizing that faith is a vital condition for receiving God’s blessings.

questions.question: How should Christians respond to accusations or opposition, as modeled by Jesus in Matthew 9?
options: Respond with wisdom and continue doing good works
Retaliate against accusers
Avoid all confrontation
Ignore God’s calling
questions.correctAnswer: Respond with wisdom and continue doing good works
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:3-4 and 34 shows Jesus addressing accusations of blasphemy with insight and continuing His mission of healing and teaching, teaching perseverance and wisdom in trials.

questions.question: What does the passage about the harvest and laborers teach us about evangelism and prayer?
options: We should pray for more workers to share the Gospel
Evangelism is unnecessary
Laborers should work alone
Prayer is not related to evangelism
questions.correctAnswer: We should pray for more workers to share the Gospel
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:37-38 teaches that the harvest is plentiful but workers are few, urging believers to pray for God to send laborers, emphasizing the importance of prayer in evangelism.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 9, Jesus only healed physical sickness but did not address spiritual forgiveness.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:2-6 shows Jesus forgiving the paralytic’s sins before healing him, demonstrating that Jesus addresses both spiritual and physical needs.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus avoided interacting with people considered sinners according to Matthew 9.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:10-11 records Jesus eating with publicans and sinners, showing His willingness to associate with and call sinners to repentance.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus said, 'The harvest truly is ______, but the labourers are few.'
options: plenteous
small
finished
hidden
questions.correctAnswer: plenteous
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:37 uses the word 'plenteous' to describe the abundant harvest needing workers, teaching about the great opportunity for evangelism.

questions.question: In Matthew 9, how does Jesus demonstrate humility and integrity in His ministry?
options: He serves all people including sinners without partiality
He demands special treatment
He avoids poor and sick people
He only ministers to religious leaders
questions.correctAnswer: He serves all people including sinners without partiality
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:10-11 and 35 show Jesus ministering to sinners and healing all sickness, displaying humility and integrity by serving everyone regardless of status.

questions.question: According to Matthew 9, how should believers respond when they see God’s power at work in healing and miracles?
options: Marvel and glorify God for His power
Ignore the miracles
Doubt the authenticity
Blame the sick for their condition
questions.correctAnswer: Marvel and glorify God for His power
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:8 describes how the multitudes marveled and glorified God when they saw Jesus’ healing power, encouraging believers to respond with praise and worship.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 9 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 9.

questions.question: In Matthew 9:2, Jesus forgives the sins of a man sick of the palsy before healing him. Which Old Testament prophecy does this act of forgiving sins before healing most directly fulfill?
options: Isaiah 53:5, which speaks of the suffering servant bearing the iniquities of many
Psalm 23:1, which describes the Lord as a shepherd
Genesis 12:3, which promises blessings to Abraham
Exodus 20:12, the commandment to honor parents
questions.correctAnswer: Isaiah 53:5, which speaks of the suffering servant bearing the iniquities of many
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:2 shows Jesus forgiving sins, fulfilling Isaiah 53:5's prophecy about the suffering servant who bears iniquities, indicating Jesus' messianic role in both spiritual and physical restoration.

questions.question: The scribes accuse Jesus of blasphemy in Matthew 9:3. What cultural or religious assumption underlies their accusation?
options: Only God can forgive sins, so Jesus claiming this is blasphemous
Healing was considered magic and therefore forbidden
Jesus was not from a priestly family
Only prophets could speak with authority
questions.correctAnswer: Only God can forgive sins, so Jesus claiming this is blasphemous
questions.explanation: In Jewish culture, forgiving sins was considered a divine prerogative, so Jesus' claim (Matthew 9:3) was seen as blasphemy by the scribes who understood this claim as equating himself with God.

questions.question: In Matthew 9:6, Jesus states that the Son of Man has power on earth to forgive sins. How does the title 'Son of Man' connect to Daniel 7 in the Old Testament?
options: It refers to the divine figure given authority, glory, and sovereign power by God
It denotes a simple human being with no divine status
It is a title given to Moses in the wilderness
It is a term used only for prophets
questions.correctAnswer: It refers to the divine figure given authority, glory, and sovereign power by God
questions.explanation: The title 'Son of Man' in Matthew 9:6 connects to Daniel 7:13-14, where a divine figure is given authority and power, indicating Jesus’ divine authority to forgive sins and heal.

questions.question: Matthew 9:9 describes Jesus calling Matthew, a tax collector, to follow Him. What is the significance of Jesus calling a tax collector in the Jewish socio-religious context?
options: Tax collectors were despised as collaborators with the Roman oppressors and seen as sinners
Tax collectors were respected leaders in synagogues
Tax collectors were Levites responsible for temple duties
Tax collectors were considered priests
questions.correctAnswer: Tax collectors were despised as collaborators with the Roman oppressors and seen as sinners
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:9 shows Jesus calling a tax collector, highlighting His mission to reach out to social outcasts and sinners, as tax collectors were despised in Jewish society for their collaboration with Roman authorities.

questions.question: In Matthew 9:13, Jesus quotes Hosea 6:6 with 'I will have mercy, and not sacrifice.' What literary device is Jesus using here?
options: Intertextual allusion to the prophetic critique of superficial religiosity
Parable illustrating agricultural practices
Typology predicting the destruction of the temple
Hyperbole emphasizing the importance of fasting
questions.correctAnswer: Intertextual allusion to the prophetic critique of superficial religiosity
questions.explanation: Jesus’ quotation in Matthew 9:13 is an intertextual allusion to Hosea 6:6, using prophetic critique to emphasize that God desires mercy over ritual sacrifice, challenging Pharisaic legalism.

questions.question: The analogy of new cloth on an old garment in Matthew 9:16 serves to illustrate what theological principle?
options: The incompatibility of Jesus’ new teachings with old Jewish legalism
The importance of preserving old traditions without change
The need to mend broken relationships through fasting
The requirement to combine old and new wines for spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: The incompatibility of Jesus’ new teachings with old Jewish legalism
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:16 uses the metaphor of new cloth on old garment to illustrate that Jesus’ new covenant teachings cannot be patched onto the old legalistic framework without damage.

questions.question: The story of the woman with an issue of blood in Matthew 9:20-22 demonstrates what theme commonly found in the Gospels?
options: Faith as a means of healing and restoration
The rejection of Jesus by religious leaders
The importance of ritual purity laws
The role of apostles in spreading the Gospel
questions.correctAnswer: Faith as a means of healing and restoration
questions.explanation: In Matthew 9:20-22, the woman’s faith in touching Jesus’ garment leads to her healing, emphasizing the Gospel theme that faith is crucial for divine healing and restoration.

questions.question: When Jesus raises the ruler's daughter in Matthew 9:23-26, He says she 'sleepeth.' What literary device is being employed here?
options: Euphemism for death, indicating temporary state before resurrection
Metaphor for spiritual blindness
Allegory for Israel’s exile
Simile comparing life to a journey
questions.correctAnswer: Euphemism for death, indicating temporary state before resurrection
questions.explanation: In Matthew 9:24, Jesus uses 'sleepeth' as a euphemism for death, foreshadowing the resurrection motif and emphasizing that death is temporary before God’s power restores life.

questions.question: In Matthew 9:29, Jesus says, 'According to your faith be it unto you.' How does this statement reflect the Greek word 'pistis' used in the New Testament?
options: 'Pistis' denotes trust and belief that activates divine power
'Pistis' is primarily about intellectual assent without action
'Pistis' refers to ritual sacrifices
'Pistis' means legal observance
questions.correctAnswer: 'Pistis' denotes trust and belief that activates divine power
questions.explanation: The Greek word 'pistis' in Matthew 9:29 reflects trust and active belief, indicating faith’s dynamic role in effecting healing and miracles.

questions.question: The Pharisees claim in Matthew 9:34 that Jesus casts out devils through the prince of devils. What is the theological implication of this accusation?
options: They accuse Jesus of demonic collusion, denying His divine authority
They acknowledge Jesus’ divine power
They are expressing fear of Roman authorities
They seek to promote Jesus as a messianic figure
questions.correctAnswer: They accuse Jesus of demonic collusion, denying His divine authority
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:34 shows Pharisees accusing Jesus of using demonic power, an attempt to discredit His miracles by denying His divine authority and attributing it to evil.

questions.question: Matthew 9:35 shows Jesus teaching, preaching, and healing in all cities and villages. How does this tripartite ministry reflect the Old Testament prophetic tradition?
options: It mirrors the roles of prophets who proclaimed God's word, called for repentance, and performed signs
It is unique to the New Testament with no Old Testament precedent
It reflects the duties of Levitical priests exclusively
It imitates Roman imperial propaganda
questions.correctAnswer: It mirrors the roles of prophets who proclaimed God's word, called for repentance, and performed signs
questions.explanation: Jesus’ ministry in Matthew 9:35 continues the prophetic tradition of proclaiming God's message, calling for repentance, and confirming His authority through healing signs.

questions.question: In Matthew 9:36, Jesus is moved with compassion because the crowds were 'as sheep having no shepherd.' What Old Testament passage does this imagery most directly echo?
options: Psalm 23, which describes God as the shepherd of Israel
Isaiah 53, the suffering servant song
Genesis 1, the creation of man
Exodus 20, the Ten Commandments
questions.correctAnswer: Psalm 23, which describes God as the shepherd of Israel
questions.explanation: The imagery in Matthew 9:36 recalls Psalm 23’s shepherd metaphor, highlighting the spiritual neglect of the people and Jesus’ role as their compassionate shepherd.

questions.question: In Matthew 9:38, Jesus instructs his disciples to pray for laborers to be sent into the harvest. What broader eschatological theme does this verse connect to in the New Testament?
options: The final gathering of the elect at the end of the age
The destruction of Jerusalem by the Romans
The establishment of the Davidic kingdom in exile
The fall of Babylon
questions.correctAnswer: The final gathering of the elect at the end of the age
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:38’s harvest imagery points to the eschatological theme of the final gathering of believers, a motif developed in passages like Matthew 13 and Revelation.

questions.question: True or False: In Matthew 9:11, the Pharisees criticize Jesus for dining with publicans and sinners because they believed fellowship implied approval.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: The Pharisees in Matthew 9:11 criticize Jesus for eating with sinners, reflecting cultural norms where sharing meals implied social and religious approval.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 9:30, Jesus instructs the healed blind men to openly proclaim His miracles to spread His fame.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: In Matthew 9:30, Jesus commands the healed blind men to keep the miracle secret, but they disobey and spread His fame anyway.

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 9 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 9 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What authority does Jesus demonstrate when he forgives the sins of the paralytic man?
options: Authority to forgive sins on earth
Authority to perform miracles only
Authority given by the Pharisees
Authority over the Jewish law
questions.correctAnswer: Authority to forgive sins on earth
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:6 shows Jesus declaring His power to forgive sins, which is a divine prerogative. This authority is consistent with Psalm 103:3 which speaks of God forgiving sins, Isaiah 43:25 where God declares He blots out transgressions, Mark 2:10 where Jesus claims authority to forgive sins, and John 5:21 where the Son gives life just as the Father does.

questions.question: How does Jesus respond to the Pharisees' accusation that He blasphemes when forgiving sins?
options: He questions their evil thoughts in their hearts
He remains silent
He denies the accusation
He refers them to Moses’ law
questions.correctAnswer: He questions their evil thoughts in their hearts
questions.explanation: In Matthew 9:4, Jesus knows their inner thoughts and confronts them, highlighting His divine insight. This aligns with 1 Kings 8:39 where God knows the heart, Jeremiah 17:10 on God searching hearts, Hebrews 4:12 describing the word piercing to the heart, and Psalm 139:2 emphasizing God’s knowledge of thoughts.

questions.question: Who did Jesus call to follow Him as recorded in Matthew 9?
options: Matthew, the tax collector
Peter, the fisherman
James, the son of Zebedee
John, the beloved disciple
questions.correctAnswer: Matthew, the tax collector
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:9 records Jesus calling Matthew, a tax collector, to follow Him. This highlights the inclusiveness of Jesus’ call, consistent with Luke 5:27-28, Mark 2:14, and the theme in Isaiah 55:1 where the invitation is extended to all.

questions.question: Why did Jesus say He eats with publicans and sinners?
options: Because the whole do not need a physician, but the sick do
Because He wanted to offend the Pharisees
Because He was unaware of their sins
Because He was breaking the law
questions.correctAnswer: Because the whole do not need a physician, but the sick do
questions.explanation: In Matthew 9:12, Jesus explains His mission to reach sinners needing spiritual healing, resembling the role of a physician. This is consistent with Luke 5:31, Mark 2:17, Isaiah 53:4 describing the suffering servant bearing sickness, and Hebrews 7:25 where Jesus intercedes for sinners.

questions.question: What Old Testament principle does Jesus reference when He says, 'I will have mercy, and not sacrifice'?
options: The priority of mercy over ritual
The necessity of animal sacrifices
The importance of ceremonial fasting
The law of tithing
questions.correctAnswer: The priority of mercy over ritual
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:13 quotes Hosea 6:6 emphasizing God's desire for mercy rather than ritual sacrifice. This principle is also seen in Micah 6:8, Proverbs 21:3, Psalm 51:16-17, and Isaiah 1:11-17 where God desires justice and mercy over burnt offerings.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe the time for fasting in relation to His presence?
options: When the bridegroom is taken away, then fasting will begin
Fasting is always required for His disciples
Fasting is unnecessary at all times
Fasting should be done only in secret
questions.correctAnswer: When the bridegroom is taken away, then fasting will begin
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:15 uses the metaphor of the bridegroom to indicate that while Jesus is present, fasting is not appropriate, but it will be necessary in His absence. This relates to John 3:29, Isaiah 61:10, and 2 Corinthians 11:2-3 where the bridegroom imagery is used, and Joel 2:12 on fasting in times of repentance.

questions.question: What illustration does Jesus use to explain why old religious practices cannot contain the new covenant?
options: New cloth on an old garment and new wine into old bottles
Planting new seeds in old soil
Building a new house on old foundations
Mixing water with oil
questions.correctAnswer: New cloth on an old garment and new wine into old bottles
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:16-17 uses these images to show that the new covenant requires new forms and structures, consistent with Luke 5:36-39, Jeremiah 31:31-34 about the new covenant, Ezekiel 36:26 on a new heart, and 2 Corinthians 5:17 about becoming a new creation.

questions.question: What miracle demonstrates Jesus’ power over death in Matthew 9?
options: Raising the ruler’s daughter from death
Healing the woman with the issue of blood
Healing two blind men
Casting out a devil from a dumb man
questions.correctAnswer: Raising the ruler’s daughter from death
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:18-26 records Jesus raising the ruler’s daughter, demonstrating His authority over death itself, consistent with John 11:43-44, Luke 8:54-55, Mark 5:41-42, and Acts 9:40 where Jesus or His apostles raise the dead.

questions.question: What role does faith play in the healing of the woman with the issue of blood?
options: Her faith made her whole
Faith was unnecessary for her healing
Her faith delayed her healing
Faith was only for the disciples, not her
questions.correctAnswer: Her faith made her whole
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:22 records Jesus affirming the woman’s faith as the cause of her healing, aligning with Mark 5:34, Hebrews 11:6 on faith pleasing God, James 5:15 on prayer of faith healing the sick, and Romans 5:1 on justification by faith.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus telling the mourners that the ruler’s daughter is 'not dead, but sleepeth'?
options: It signifies the temporary nature of death for believers
It means she was actually alive
It was meant to confuse the crowd
It indicates that death has no power at all
questions.correctAnswer: It signifies the temporary nature of death for believers
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:24 uses 'sleep' as a metaphor for death, indicating resurrection hope, consistent with 1 Thessalonians 4:13-14, John 11:11-14, Acts 7:60, and 1 Corinthians 15:51-52 where death is described as sleep for believers.

questions.question: How did the blind men address Jesus when they sought healing?
options: Thou Son of David, have mercy on us
Rabbi, teach us the law
Lord, forgive our sins
Master, heal our bodies
questions.correctAnswer: Thou Son of David, have mercy on us
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:27 records the blind men calling Jesus 'Son of David,' a messianic title, showing recognition of His divine mission. This is consistent with Matthew 21:9, 1 Chronicles 17:11-14, Isaiah 9:6-7, and Luke 18:38 where the Messiah is linked to David’s lineage.

questions.question: What condition does Jesus give before healing the two blind men?
options: Believe ye that I am able to do this
Pray for forgiveness
Fast for seven days
Give alms to the poor
questions.correctAnswer: Believe ye that I am able to do this
questions.explanation: In Matthew 9:28, Jesus asks if they believe He can heal them, emphasizing faith as essential. This is supported by Mark 10:52, Hebrews 11:1 on faith, John 14:12 on believing works, and James 2:17 on faith without works being dead.

questions.question: What accusation did the Pharisees make about Jesus’ power to cast out devils?
options: He casts out devils through the prince of the devils
He uses magic arts
He is a false prophet
He works by the power of Beelzebub’s angels
questions.correctAnswer: He casts out devils through the prince of the devils
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:34 records the Pharisees accusing Jesus of using satanic power, which Jesus refutes in Matthew 12:24-28. This also appears in Mark 3:22, Luke 11:15, and reinforces the biblical theme that Jesus’ power is from God, not evil sources.

questions.question: What was Jesus’ emotional response when He saw the multitudes?
options: He was moved with compassion
He was angry with them
He was indifferent
He was confused
questions.correctAnswer: He was moved with compassion
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:36 shows Jesus’ compassion for the people who were like sheep without a shepherd, reflecting God’s heart throughout Scripture (Isaiah 40:11, Psalm 23:1, Ezekiel 34:11-16, John 10:11).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the harvest in relation to laborers?
options: The harvest is plenteous, but the laborers are few
The harvest is small, so laborers are not needed
The laborers are many, but the harvest is poor
The harvest is plenteous and laborers are many
questions.correctAnswer: The harvest is plenteous, but the laborers are few
questions.explanation: Matthew 9:37 highlights the great need for workers in God's kingdom, echoing themes in Luke 10:2, John 4:35, Proverbs 10:5, and Isaiah 6:8 where the call for laborers is urgent.
